options.text:
Hormone Gland Function
Thyroxine Thyroid gland Decreases basal metabolic rate

Hormone Gland Function
Glucagon β -cells of pancreas Stimulates glycogenolysis resulting in an increased blood sugar

Hormone Gland Function
Glucocorticoids Adrenal medulla Stimulate gluconeogenesis, lipolysis and proteolysis

solution.text:
Calcitonin, also known as Thyrocalcitonin is a hormone produced by the thyroid gland. The function of this hormone is to prevent the reabsorption of calcium from the bones. Thus, it is responsible for decreasing blood calcium levels.

Thyroxine, also known as Tetraiodothyronine (T4) is a hormone secreted by the thyroid gland. This hormone is responsible for increasing the basal metabolic rate of the body and regulating it.

Glucagon is a hormone secreted by alpha cells of Islet of Langerhans of pancreas. It increases blood sugar levels by stimulating glycogenolysis.

Glucocorticoids are hormones secreted by the adrenal cortex. They stimulate gluconeogenesis, lipolysis and proteolysis.
